member.name: M:Microsoft.WindowsAzure.MobileServices.FilterBuildingExpressionVisitor.CheckVBStringCompareExpression(System.Linq.Expressions.BinaryExpression,System.Linq.Expressions.BinaryExpression@)
member.summary: Checks if the binary expression is a string comparison emitted by the Visual Basic compiler.
member.remarks: The VB compiler translates string comparisons such as (Function(x) x.Name = "a string value") not as a binary expression with the field on the left side and the string value on the right side. Instead, it converts it into a call to Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.Operators.CompareString (or Microsoft.VisualBasic.CompilerServices.EmbeddedOperators for phone platforms) for the string value, and compares the expression to zero.
member.param: The binary expression to check.
A normalized string comparison expression.
member.returns: True if the expression is a string comparison expression emitted by the VB compiler, otherwise false

member.summary: Creates a collection of instances for the members of a given type.
member.remarks:
This method is overridden in order to handle the id property of the type. Because multiple property names ("id" with different casings) are all treated as the id property, we must ensure that there is one and only one id property for the type. Also, the id property should be ignored when it is the default or null value and it should always serialize to JSON with a lowercase 'id' name.
This method also checks for and applies and system property attributes.
